definitions.definition: a person or thing that is loved and admired very much

examples.text: He has been my idol since I was a child.
a **fallen idol** *(= somebody who is no longer popular)*
She is still my biggest idol.
He'd always wanted to meet his idol.
The film made an idol of her.
a matinee idol of a bygone era

definitions.definition: a statue that is worshipped as a god

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French idole, from Latin idolum ‘image, form’ (used in ecclesiastical Latin in the sense ‘idol’), from Greek eidōlon, from eidos ‘form, shape’.
